title: Linguine with Burst Tomatoes and Chiles
summary: Linguine with Burst Tomatoes and Chiles might be just the main course you are searching for. For 91 cents per serving, this recipe covers 17% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 482 calories, 17g of protein, and 16g of fat. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. Head to the store and pick up oil-packed calabrian chiles, pepper, kosher salt, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the kosher salt you could follow this main course with the Low Fat Crumbs Cake (Kosher-Dairy) as a dessert. It is a good option if you're following a pescatarian diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 73%. This score is solid. Try Bucatini with Burst Tomatoes, Pasta with Burst Tomatoes and Mascarpone, and Farfalle with Wilted Fris√©e and Burst Tomatoes for similar recipes.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Pulse toast in a food processor to fine crumbs; set aside.                                                                Cook pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water, stirring occasionally, until al dente; drain, reserving 1 1/2 cups pasta cooking liquid.                                                                Meanwhile, heat chiles and 3 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium heat until sizzling, about 2 minutes. Add tomatoes, increase heat to medium-high, and cook, turning tomatoes occasionally, until blistered in spots, about 3 minutes. Continue to cook, lightly crushing tomatoes, until beginning to break down, about 3 minutes.                                                                Add pasta, 1 cup pasta cooking liquid, and 1/4 cup Pecorino to skillet and cook, tossing and adding more liquid as needed, until sauce coats pasta, about 2 minutes.                                                                Serve pasta seasoned with salt and pepper and topped with remaining Pecorino and reserved breadcrumbs.

steps.step: Pulse toast in a food processor to fine crumbs; set aside.
Cook pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water, stirring occasionally, until al dente; drain, reserving 1 1/2 cups pasta cooking liquid.
Meanwhile, heat chiles and 3 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium heat until sizzling, about 2 minutes.

Add tomatoes, increase heat to medium-high, and cook, turning tomatoes occasionally, until blistered in spots, about 3 minutes. Continue to cook, lightly crushing tomatoes, until beginning to break down, about 3 minutes.
Add pasta, 1 cup pasta cooking liquid, and 1/4 cup Pecorino to skillet and cook, tossing and adding more liquid as needed, until sauce coats pasta, about 2 minutes.
Serve pasta seasoned with salt and pepper and topped with remaining Pecorino and reserved breadcrumbs.
